intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. minima, commonly known as the lesser eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia officinalis var. minima has been historically used in herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
